inclusion.criterion: consented to the study and extensive baseline testing will be completed at St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital in Houston, Texas.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: his/her own bone marrow harvested and later injected, if randomized to receive active treatment.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: NOGA mapping is performed and the processed cells or placebo are injected under electromechanical guidance into the affected areas of the left ventricle.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Follow-up testing, including quality of life and NOGA mapping, is done at the time of injection, as well as at 6 months.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: This is a phase I, double blind trial to evaluate the use of Aldehyde Dehydrogenase-Bright (ALDHbr) in ischemic cardiomyopathy patients.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The study hypothesis is that transendocardial injections of autologous bone marrow cells in patients with end-stage ischemic heart disease is safe, can provide neovascularization, and can improve perfusion and myocardial contractility.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A maximum of 60 patients will be enrolled in the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At the end of 6 months, after the required testing has been completed, the patients will be told whether they were in the control group or not.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The patients in the control group will be given the option to crossover and actually receive stem cell injection.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At the time of crossover, which then becomes the baseline, patients will begin the follow-up with all testing including clinic visits for one year for a total of 18 months follow-up.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Canadian cardiovascular (CV) Class II-IV angina and/or congestive heart failure (CHF) symptoms
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ejection fraction less than or equal to 45%
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Age less than 18 or greater than 70
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: History of cancer in last 5 years
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: HIV positive; hepatitis B or C positive.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 53-year-old man with Paget's disease of bone, confirmed by increased uptake of radioactive substance and urinary pyridinoline. He has bilateral swellings around the molars and several extraoral lesions on the head and face.
